workflow.name: Validate workflows: GPT-4o with Drive, Slack & Gmail
workflow.description:
## üìò Description:
This workflow automates end-to-end validation, assessment, and reporting of n8n workflow JSON templates using Google Drive, Azure OpenAI GPT-4o, Gmail, and Slack.
It retrieves workflows from a Drive folder, validates their integrity, analyzes their quality against official n8n Template Publishing Guidelines, generates a structured report, converts it into a formatted .txt file, and archives it with instant notifications sent via Slack and email.
It ensures a fully autonomous review cycle for workflow publishing, complete with error tracking, AI-based evaluations, and automated reporting.

## ‚öôÔ∏è What This Workflow Does (Step-by-Step)

‚ñ∂Ô∏è When Clicking ‚ÄòExecute Workflow‚Äô (Manual Trigger)
 Initiates the validation pipeline manually, allowing users to start the batch evaluation process on demand.

üìÇ Fetch Workflow Files from Drive
 Retrieves all JSON workflow files from the ‚Äún8n json checker‚Äù Google Drive folder, including their metadata (ID, name, timestamps).
 Acts as the primary input source for the validation loop.

üîÑ Process Files One by One
 Splits the list of files into individual items to ensure controlled, sequential processing.
 Prevents API overload and maintains order during AI evaluation.

‚¨áÔ∏è Download Workflow JSON File
 Fetches each workflow file from Drive using its file ID.
 Ensures a complete, uncorrupted copy before validation begins.

üîç Validate File Download Success (IF Node)
 Checks if the downloaded file includes a valid id and JSON structure.
 ‚úÖ True Path: Continues to parsing and analysis.
 ‚ùå False Path: Logs the failed file to a Google Sheet for audit and debugging.

üßæ Parse JSON Workflow Structure
 Converts raw JSON files into object data structures readable by AI.
 Verifies JSON syntax and schema readiness for further evaluation.

üß† GPT-4o Language Model Configuration
 Initializes Azure OpenAI‚Äôs GPT-4o as the reasoning engine for advanced workflow quality analysis.

üóÇ Conversation Context Buffer
 Maintains contextual memory across multiple files, enabling GPT-4o to stay consistent across batch validations and apply uniform judgment standards.

ü§ñ AI-Powered Workflow Quality Analyzer
 Uses GPT-4o to evaluate each workflow against eight defined quality checkpoints:
 1Ô∏è‚É£ JSON Validity
 2Ô∏è‚É£ Documentation Presence
 3Ô∏è‚É£ Security & Credentials
 4Ô∏è‚É£ Node Naming Standards
 5Ô∏è‚É£ Workflow Validity
 6Ô∏è‚É£ Originality & Usefulness
 7Ô∏è‚É£ Industry-Readiness
 8Ô∏è‚É£ Visual Presentation

Produces a structured JSON output summarizing each checkpoint‚Äôs result, reason, and overall assessment.

üß© Format AI Response to JSON Schema
 Normalizes GPT-4o output into a clean JSON schema for easy parsing.
 Ensures consistency across all AI-generated reports.

üìù Generate Human-Readable Report
 Transforms structured JSON results into a formatted plain-text report with headers, dividers, and human-friendly phrasing.
 Provides an executive-style summary of workflow quality.

üìã Convert Report to Text File Format
 Converts the formatted analysis into a .txt file suitable for archival.
 Preserves visual layout and divider styles for readability.

‚òÅÔ∏è Archive Validation Report to Drive
 Uploads the finalized text report to the ‚ÄúEOD Updates report‚Äù Google Drive folder.
 Automatically names files with a timestamp (e.g., workflow_report_2025-11-03_103020.txt) for easy tracking.

üìß Email Detailed Report to Stakeholders
 Sends an HTML-formatted email summary including report metadata: file name, size, type, created time, and owner.
 Includes ‚ÄúView in Drive‚Äù and ‚ÄúDownload‚Äù buttons for quick access.

üí¨ Send Validation Summary to Slack
 Notifies internal teams with a Slack message summarizing the workflow‚Äôs assessment result, report name, size, and links to Drive resources.
 Ensures real-time transparency for the QA team.

‚ö†Ô∏è Log Failed Downloads to Error Sheet
 Captures download or validation errors in a dedicated Google Sheet.
 Supports quick debugging and failure traceability across runs.

## üß© Prerequisites
Google Drive OAuth connection (Techdome Account)
Azure OpenAI GPT-4o credentials
Gmail and Slack API integrations
Google Sheets connection for error tracking

## üí° Key Benefits
 ‚úÖ Fully automated n8n workflow review and quality assurance pipeline
 ‚úÖ Structured GPT-4o analysis aligned with official publishing standards
 ‚úÖ Instant report archival and real-time notifications
 ‚úÖ Built-in error logging and recovery tracking
 ‚úÖ Reduces manual review workload by over 90%

## üë• Perfect For
n8n Template Publishers & Marketplace Moderators
QA Engineers validating workflow submissions
Automation Teams managing template quality and compliance
Organizations maintaining standardized workflow repositories

nodes.name: Convert Report to Text File Format
Format AI Response to JSON Schema

options.systemMessage:
=You are an expert n8n template validator.  
Your job is to **analyze the provided workflow JSON** against the official n8n Template Publishing Guidelines.  
Be precise, context-aware, and avoid repeating generic text across different workflows.  
Each evaluation must be based on the actual JSON input.

### Evaluation Criteria
Check the workflow against these rules:

1. **JSON Validity**
   - Pass if JSON is well-formed, importable, and contains nodes, connections, and parameters.
   - Fail if malformed, missing required fields, or has syntax issues.

2. **Sticky Notes & Documentation**
   - Pass if sticky notes exist with Markdown (## headings) and useful explanations.
   - Fail if sticky notes are completely missing or use raw HTML.
   - Neutral if notes exist but are minimal ‚Äî suggest improvements.

3. **Critical Instructions for Security Rule**
- Credential IDs or names (e.g., {"id": "...", "name": "..."}) are **valid n8n references** and MUST NOT be flagged.  
- Only fail **Security & Credentials** if actual plain-text secrets are found, such as:  
  - API keys starting with `sk_` (e.g., Stripe keys)  
  - Raw `Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE` tokens  
  - Hardcoded passwords or tokens  
- Do not confuse credential references with raw secrets.  

4. **Node Naming**
   - Pass if functional nodes (Code, Google Sheets, Slack, etc.) have descriptive names.
   - Fail if left as defaults like `Code`, `HTTP Request`, or `Loop Over Items1`.

5. **Workflow Validity**
   - Pass if all nodes are connected and the workflow is importable.
   - Fail if nodes are isolated or connections are broken.

6. **Originality & Quality**
   - Pass if it solves a real use case and is not trivial or copied.
   - Fail if plagiarized or overly simplistic.

7. **Industry-Readiness**
   - Pass if modular, expandable, and includes at least basic error handling (try/catch, fallback, retries).
   - Fail if completely fragile with no resilience.

8. **Presentation**
   - Pass if layout is neat, nodes are arranged clearly, and sticky notes are formatted cleanly.
   - Fail if messy, cluttered, or contains irrelevant branding.

---

### Output Format
Respond ONLY in **valid JSON**, following this structure:

```json
{
  "workflow_name": "Name from JSON or 'Unknown'",
  "workflow_id": "ID or versionId",
  "results": [
    {
      "checkpoint": "JSON Validity",
      "status": "‚úÖ or ‚ùå",
      "reason": "Explain briefly why it passed/failed, referencing specific JSON elements."
    },
    {
      "checkpoint": "Sticky Notes & Documentation",
      "status": "‚úÖ or ‚ùå",
      "reason": "..."
    },
    {
      "checkpoint": "Security & Credentials",
      "status": "‚úÖ or ‚ùå",
      "reason": "..."
    },
    {
      "checkpoint": "Node Naming",
      "status": "‚úÖ or ‚ùå",
      "reason": "..."
    },
    {
      "checkpoint": "Workflow Validity",
      "status": "‚úÖ or ‚ùå",
      "reason": "..."
    },
    {
      "checkpoint": "Originality & Quality",
      "status": "‚úÖ or ‚ùå",
      "reason": "..."
    },
    {
      "checkpoint": "Industry-Readiness",
      "status": "‚úÖ or ‚ùå",
      "reason": "..."
    },
    {
      "checkpoint": "Presentation",
      "status": "‚úÖ or ‚ùå",
      "reason": "..."
    }
  ],
  "overall_assessment": "PASSED or FAILED",
  "summary": "One or two sentences summarizing strengths and weaknesses."
}

parameters.text:
=:white_check_mark: *Workflow Analysis Report Generated*

*Workflow Name:* {{ $(' Convert Report to Text File Format').first().json.workflow_name || 'N/A' }}
*Assessment:* {{ $(' Convert Report to Text File Format').first().json.overall_assessment || 'PASSED' }} ‚úÖ

:file_folder: *Report Details*
- File Name: `{{ $json.name }}`
- File Size: {{ (parseInt($json.size) / 1024).toFixed(2) }} KB
- Created: {{ new Date($json.createdTime).toLocaleString('en-US', { month: 'short', day: 'numeric', year: 'numeric', hour: '2-digit', minute: '2-digit' }) }}

:link: *Access Report*
- <{{ $json.webViewLink }}|View in Google Drive>
- <{{ $json.webContentLink }}|Download Report>

---
_Automated workflow validation completed successfully_ :rocket:

parameters.subject: =EOD Update

nodes.name: Log Failed Downloads to Error Sheet

parameters.content:
## üß† Automated Workflow Quality Validator  
This automation validates uploaded n8n workflows for correctness, documentation quality, and security compliance.  
It fetches workflow files from Google Drive, analyzes them via GPT-4o, and generates a formatted text + HTML report ‚Äî automatically archived and shared with the team.

### üîπ Core Capabilities
1. Fetch JSON workflows from Google Drive  
2. Validate structure, documentation, and naming  
3. AI-driven scoring with GPT-4o model  
4. Generate human-readable summary report (.txt)  
5. Archive report in Drive and send to Gmail + Slack  
6. Log errors for failed downloads or parsing

### üîπ Technologies
- **AI Model:** GPT-4o (Azure OpenAI)  
- **Storage:** Google Drive + Sheets  
- **Communication:** Slack + Gmail  
- **Validation Schema:** JSON-based structured analysis

### üîπ Recommended Usage
- Schedule weekly workflow audits  
- Keep folder ‚Äún8n json checker‚Äù organized  
- Use reports for peer review and publishing decisions

## üîç Fetch Workflow Files from Drive  
Retrieves all JSON workflows awaiting validation from the Google Drive folder ‚Äún8n json checker.‚Äù  
Supports batch processing and returns file metadata including IDs, names, and timestamps.  
Acts as the entry point for the workflow validation pipeline.

## ‚öôÔ∏è Process Files One by One  
Splits fetched workflow files into manageable batches.  
Ensures sequential validation and prevents overload of API limits.  
Each file is processed individually through the downstream validation sequence.

## ‚¨áÔ∏è Download & Verify Workflow File  
Downloads workflow JSON content from Drive using file IDs.  
Runs validation to ensure file integrity and prevents corrupt or empty downloads.  
If validation fails, logs errors to Google Sheets for review.

## üß© Parse JSON Workflow Structure  
Converts raw JSON files into readable object format.  
Prepares data for GPT-4o-powered analysis and structural validation.  
Ensures correct syntax and readable schema before AI processing.

## ü§ñ AI-Powered Workflow Quality Analyzer  
Analyzes parsed workflow JSON using GPT-4o against official n8n publishing guidelines.  
Evaluates eight checkpoints: validity, documentation, security, naming, linkage, originality, resilience, and presentation.  
Outputs a structured JSON assessment for reporting.

## üß† Conversation Context Buffer  
Maintains short-term conversational memory for multi-file analysis.  
Ensures consistent AI evaluation across multiple workflows in a batch.

## üßæ Format AI Response to JSON Schema  
Standardizes GPT-4o output into consistent, machine-readable JSON fields.  
Ensures downstream nodes can process and summarize data cleanly.

## üìù Generate Human-Readable Report  
Transforms structured JSON analysis into a formatted text summary with clear headers and section dividers.  
Highlights workflow performance across all evaluation checkpoints.

## üìã Convert Report to Text File Format  
Converts formatted analysis report into a `.txt` file ready for archival.  
Maintains spacing, dividers, and alignment for readability.

## ‚òÅÔ∏è Archive Validation Report to Drive  
Uploads generated text report to the Google Drive folder ‚ÄúEOD Updates report.‚Äù  
Names the file with a timestamp (e.g., `workflow_report_YYYY-MM-DD_HHmmss.txt`).  
Triggers notification sequence upon successful upload.

## üí¨ Slack Notification Summary  
Posts a concise validation summary message to Slack with key details:  
- Workflow name  
- Validation status (‚úÖ PASSED / ‚ùå FAILED)  
- File size and creation time  
Includes quick Drive access links for team visibility.

## üìß Email Detailed Report to Stakeholders  
Sends an HTML-formatted summary email with embedded style and report metadata.  
Includes file details (name, size, owner, creation time) and quick access buttons for viewing or downloading the report.

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Log Failed Downloads to Error Sheet  
Captures failed file downloads or validation issues in a dedicated Google Sheet tab.  
Ensures transparency and quick debugging for workflow review errors.

Log Failed Downloads to Error Sheet

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
